remarks: An alternate way to show a group operation.  Exercise 1 of [Herstein] p. 57.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
isgrp2d.1 $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
isgrp2d.2 $e |- ( ph -> X =/= (/) ) $.
isgrp2d.3 $e |- ( ph -> G : ( X X. X ) --> X ) $.
isgrp2d.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ y e. X /\ z e. X ) ) -> ( ( x G y ) G z ) = ( x G ( y G z ) ) ) $.
isgrp2d.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ y e. X ) ) -> E. z e. X ( z G x ) = y ) $.
isgrp2d.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ y e. X ) ) -> E. z e. X ( x G z ) = y ) $.
isgrp2d $p |- ( ph -> G e. GrpOp ) $.
